result.execSummary:
The defendant Troy R. Cotter was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Troy R. Cotter is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Troy R. Cotter was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
AODA

Count 2 - Dismissed

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Defendant Troy R. Cotter in court.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls 14CF187, 14TR923, 14TR924 and 14TR925 @ 11:29 a.m. State moves to amend ct 1 to possession THC as first offense, unclassified misd. Def will plea to amended ct, dismiss ct 2, 1 yr probation, AODA and costs.  14TR923 - move to amend to <.15 and to amend BAC to .14. Def agrees. Court amends ct 1 of 14CF187 as stated. Guilty plea. Ct 2 dismissed. Court strikes. Reviews atty rights, finds Def understands and waiver freely made. Plea to ct 1 guilty. Ct 2 dismissed. Court reviews constitutional and trial rights. Factual basis. Court finds Def understands, accepts plea and finds guilty of ct 1 as amended. Def has nothing to say.  Court accepts agreement. Sentence withheld. 1 yr probation, AODA, costs including DNA surcharge. Postconviction rights.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. 14TR923 - Court amends to <.15 for reasons stated earlier. Plea - guilty. Court finds guilty. $887.50, 6 months revocation, retroactive to admin. susp., alcohol assessment. Apply bond in 14CF187, pp for balance. 14TR924 - amend to .14, dismissed. 14TR925 - speeding, Guilty plea. Find guilty. $225.70, pp.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

Def. given atty rights & court appointed atty. Def. makes statement & going to apply for court appointed atty. Def. needs to provide new address.  14TR923, 14TR924 & 14TR925 to follow criminal case. Bond remains.  Hearing scheduled for October 21, 2014 at 09:00 am.
